title: 115_s1626
content: Cabin Air Safety Act of 2017 This bill requires the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) to prescribe regulations: requiring flight attendants, pilots, aircraft maintenance technicians, and airport first responders to receive annual training on how to respond to incidents involving smoke or fumes on board aircraft, and the FAA must develop a standardized formnbsp, for reportingnbsp, incidents of smoke or fumes. Requiring the FAA to conduct an investigation after a report is submitted about incidents of smoke or fumes on board aircraft. And requiring commercial air carriers to install and operate a carbon monoxide detector on each bleed air stream on the aircraft .
